subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Saturday, 05 May, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Man City 0-1 Man Utd
Man Utd move to within touching distance of the title after victory at derby rivals Man City.



 
West Ham 3-1 Bolton
Carlos Tevez shrugs off the controversy surrounding his move to West Ham by firing them to a vital victory over Bolton.



 
Fulham 1-0 Liverpool
Clint Dempsey's first goal for Fulham eases the London's relegation fear.








GOLF




McLardy in lead at Italian Open
Andrew McLardy leads the Italian Open going into final round on Sunday after the rain-hit tournament was reduced from 72 holes to 54.



 
Italian Open leaderboard
Latest updates from the European Tour event in Milan.



 
Wachovia Ch'ship leaderboard
Leading scores from the first round in North Carolina.








MOTORSPORT




Rossi clinches pole in Shanghai
Five-time world champion Valentino Rossi claimed pole position for the China Grand Prix in Shanghai.



 
Rally Argentina positions
Leading positions from the World Rally Championship event.



 
Argentine weather disrupts rally
The first day of the Rally of Argentina is cancelled after bad weather strands drivers in Buenos Aires.








FORMULA ONE




Alonso backs Spanish GP changes
World champion Fernando Alonso says changes to Spain's Grand Prix track will make overtaking easier.



 
Second crash at Spanish GP track
Williams' Nico Rosberg is unhurt in the second high-speed crash at the Circuit de Catalunya this week.



 
F1 races still boring - Briatore
Renault team boss Flavio Briatore says changes aimed at livening up Formula One have not worked.








ATHLETICS




Ennis equals GB high jump record
Jessica Ennis starts the outdoor season in superb style at an international combined events meetings in Italy.



 
Back injury frustrates Radcliffe
Paula Radcliffe is unlikely to defend her World Athletics Championships marathon title because of a back problem.



 
Back injury for Aikines-Aryeetey
World Junior 100m champion Harry Aikines-Aryeetey returns to London after suffering a back injury during training in the United States.








CYCLING




GB is top cycling nation - King
British Cycling boss Peter King says this country's riders are the best in the world and will be GB's best hopes of Olympic gold.



 
Under-fire Basso parts with team
Ivan Basso quits the Discovery Channel team after an investigation into his role in a Spanish doping scandal is reopened.



 
Di Luca up for Giro after big win
Danilo Di Luca is looking forward to challenging for glory in May's Giro d'Italia after victory in the Liege-Bastogne-Liege race.








FUN AND GAMES




Holloway column
"I'm not a fan of the Kate Moss range - shorts and leggings, what's that about?"



 
Review of the week
Chelsea and Man Utd are the butt of the email jokes doing the rounds



 
FA Cup competition
Watch our best video entries and vote for your favourite
